body.instructions: You are an expert in formal verification of System-on-Chip (SoC) designs. You will be provided with (1) a specification document of an on-chip communication protocol and (2) a list of signal interaction rules derived from the protocol. The rules might contain "conceptual signals" that may refer to one or more actual signals in the specification document. For each rule, your task is to determine whether it contains conceptual signals, and create corresponding rules by enumerating through all the actual signals for each conceptual signal. Your output should be a list of rules containing only and all the corresponding actual signals. Provide the extracted rules in a JSON list format, without any additional commentary or explanation.

content.text:
[
  "If AWREADY is LOW and AWVALID is HIGH, then AWVALID remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If WREADY is LOW and WVALID is HIGH, then WVALID remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If BREADY is LOW and BVALID is HIGH, then BVALID remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If ARREADY is LOW and ARVALID is HIGH, then ARVALID remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If RREADY is LOW and RVALID is HIGH, then RVALID remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If AWREADY is LOW and AWVALID is HIGH, then AWID remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If AWREADY is LOW and AWVALID is HIGH, then AWADDR remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If AWREADY is LOW and AWVALID is HIGH, then AWLEN remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If AWREADY is LOW and AWVALID is HIGH, then AWSIZE remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If AWREADY is LOW and AWVALID is HIGH, then AWBURST remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If AWREADY is LOW and AWVALID is HIGH, then AWLOCK remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If AWREADY is LOW and AWVALID is HIGH, then AWCACHE remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If AWREADY is LOW and AWVALID is HIGH, then AWPROT remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If WREADY is LOW and WVALID is HIGH, then WID remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If WREADY is LOW and WVALID is HIGH, then WDATA remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If WREADY is LOW and WVALID is HIGH, then WSTRB remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If WREADY is LOW and WVALID is HIGH, then WLAST remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If BREADY is LOW and BVALID is HIGH, then BID remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If BREADY is LOW and BVALID is HIGH, then BRESP remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If ARREADY is LOW and ARVALID is HIGH, then ARID remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If ARREADY is LOW and ARVALID is HIGH, then ARADDR remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If ARREADY is LOW and ARVALID is HIGH, then ARLEN remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If ARREADY is LOW and ARVALID is HIGH, then ARSIZE remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If ARREADY is LOW and ARVALID is HIGH, then ARBURST remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If ARREADY is LOW and ARVALID is HIGH, then ARLOCK remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If ARREADY is LOW and ARVALID is HIGH, then ARCACHE remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If ARREADY is LOW and ARVALID is HIGH, then ARPROT remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If RREADY is LOW and RVALID is HIGH, then RID remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If RREADY is LOW and RVALID is HIGH, then RDATA remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If RREADY is LOW and RVALID is HIGH, then RRESP remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If RREADY is LOW and RVALID is HIGH, then RLAST remains stable in the next cycle."
]

body.instructions: You are an expert in formal verification of System-on-Chip (SoC) designs. You will be provided with (1) a specification document of an on-chip communication protocol and (2) a list of signal interaction rules derived from the protocol. The rules might contain "conceptual signals" that may refer to one or more actual signals in the specification document. For each rule, your task is to determine whether it contains conceptual signals, and create corresponding rules by enumerating through all the actual signals for each conceptual signal. Your output should be a list of rules containing only and all the corresponding actual signals. Provide the extracted rules in a JSON list format, without any additional commentary or explanation.

content.text:
[
  "If ARESETn is LOW, then AWVALID is LOW.",
  "If AWVALID is HIGH, then ARESETn is HIGH.",
  "If ARESETn changes from LOW to HIGH, then AWVALID is LOW.",
  "If AWVALID changes from LOW to HIGH, then ARESETn is HIGH.",
  "If ARESETn is LOW, then WVALID is LOW.",
  "If WVALID is HIGH, then ARESETn is HIGH.",
  "If ARESETn changes from LOW to HIGH, then WVALID is LOW.",
  "If WVALID changes from LOW to HIGH, then ARESETn is HIGH.",
  "If ARESETn is LOW, then BVALID is LOW.",
  "If BVALID is HIGH, then ARESETn is HIGH.",
  "If ARESETn changes from LOW to HIGH, then BVALID is LOW.",
  "If BVALID changes from LOW to HIGH, then ARESETn is HIGH.",
  "If ARESETn is LOW, then ARVALID is LOW.",
  "If ARVALID is HIGH, then ARESETn is HIGH.",
  "If ARESETn changes from LOW to HIGH, then ARVALID is LOW.",
  "If ARVALID changes from LOW to HIGH, then ARESETn is HIGH.",
  "If ARESETn is LOW, then RVALID is LOW.",
  "If RVALID is HIGH, then ARESETn is HIGH.",
  "If ARESETn changes from LOW to HIGH, then RVALID is LOW.",
  "If RVALID changes from LOW to HIGH, then ARESETn is HIGH."
]
